snippet: In the Arizona case, the power of Congress to regulate federal elections is affirmed.
abstract: Editorial welcomes Supreme Court decision re-affirming the power of Congress to regulate federal elections under the National Voter Registration Act of 1993; notes law overturns Arizona's Proposition 200 that disenfranchised tens of thousands of voters by requiring them to prove their citizenship.
lead_paragraph: In the Arizona case, the power of Congress to regulate federal elections is affirmed.

headline.main: The Court: Congress Regulates Federal Elections
headline.print_headline: The Court Rules on Rights: Congress’s power to regulate federal elections is affirmed
